title: CCV: Claude Code Viewer CLI Tool
description: Lightweight Go CLI that wraps claude with --output-format stream-json and renders beautiful TUI output similar to Claude Code's native interface. Uses Bubble Tea for TUI rendering.

title: Project setup and core type definitions
description: Initialize Go module with dependencies (bubbletea, lipgloss, bubbles). Create main.go with argument parsing. Define all SDK message type structs (SystemInit, Assistant, StreamEvent, Result, CompactBoundary). Define ContentBlock types (text, tool_use, thinking). Define ToolCall and AgentState structs.

title: Search tool renderers (Glob/Grep)
description: Glob renderer: pattern display + matched file list. Grep renderer: pattern + matches with line context highlighting. Result count summary. Collapsible results for large result sets.

title: Agent hierarchy renderer
description: Nested indentation for agent hierarchy using parent_tool_use_id tracking. Running/completed status indicators. Agent description display from Task tool input. Collapse/expand completed agents.

title: Final result summary renderer
description: Final result box with styled borders. Duration display (total and API time). Token usage breakdown by model. Cost display in USD. Error handling for error subtypes (max_turns, execution error, max_budget).

title: Integration testing and build setup
description: Build commands in Makefile. Test with simple prompts. Test with subagent prompts. Verify permission prompt forwarding works. Cross-compile for macOS, Linux, Windows.

title: README with curl one-liner installation
description:
Create a comprehensive README.md that includes:

## Requirements
- One-liner curl installation: `curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/REPO/main/install.sh | bash`
- Installation script (install.sh) that:
  - Detects OS (macOS, Linux)
  - Detects architecture (amd64, arm64)
  - Downloads the appropriate binary from GitHub releases
  - Installs to /usr/local/bin (or ~/.local/bin)
  - Verifies checksums

## README Content
- Project description and features
- Installation section with multiple methods:
  - One-liner curl install (recommended)
  - Go install: `go install github.com/REPO/cmd/ccv@latest`
  - Manual binary download
  - Build from source
- Usage examples
- Configuration options
- Requirements (claude CLI must be installed)
- Screenshots/demos (optional GIF)
- Contributing section
- License

title: Claude subprocess runner and JSON stream parser
description: Create subprocess runner that spawns claude with injected flags (--output-format stream-json --include-partial-messages). Handle stdout/stderr/stdin piping. Forward stdin for permission prompts. Implement NDJSON line-by-line parser. Type detection and unmarshaling for each message type.

title: Bubble Tea model and core UI structure
description: Create main Bubble Tea model with state. Implement Init(), Update(), View() methods. Define Lip Gloss styles (colors, borders, spacing). Handle terminal resize events. Connect parser output to UI messages via channels.

title: Application state management
description: Implement AppState with agent tracking. Track tool calls by ID in PendingTools map. Build agent hierarchy from parent_tool_use_id field. Track token counts across all agents. Manage streaming state (partial text, partial tool input).

title: Token-counting spinner component
description: Token-counting spinner with animation using bubbles spinner. Show current agent context. Update token count from usage data in assistant messages. Handle start/stop states.

title: Generic tool call renderer
description: Generic tool call box with name and input display. Formatted JSON input rendering with syntax highlighting. Status indicator (pending/running/completed/error). Collapsible detail view for large inputs.

title: Bash tool output renderer
description: Command display in styled box. Streaming output rendering. Exit code display with color coding. Truncation for long outputs with 'show more' capability.

title: File operation renderers (Read/Write)
description: Read tool: file path and line count display. Write tool: file path and bytes written. Collapsible 'Reading X files...' grouping for multiple sequential reads.

title: Edit/MultiEdit diff renderer
description: Parse old_string/new_string from Edit tool input. Unified diff rendering with colors. Line additions in green, deletions in red. File path header. Support for MultiEdit batch diffs.
